Um, in particular, if you put- that-
if you do decide to put a DAPP on the blockchain, you know,
business logic on the block- on the blockchain,
what it means is that the business logic itself is enforced by the blockchain protocol.
So again, the miners are the ones that are enforcing the business logic.
So the rules in the code are followed correctly and they can never be changed.
And moreover, uh, you get transparency.
So in fact, there's no need to trust, uh, third parties.
Everyone can look on the blockchain and make sure that the rules are followed correctly.
Now, I should caveat this a little bit in that.

um, implements a particular DAPP.

the code was changed from one version to another version,
and both versions are gonna be available for the public to inspect.

and the code has to be run the way
it was written that's basically enforced by the miners.

of putting business logic on the blockchain.
